results.title: The Still Point
results.brief_description: Sarah, (Nadine Garner), a 15-year-old girl, who has a hearing impairment, is entering a crisis period in her life. Her future depends on the ability to emerge from the sheltered world her mother has created for her. In doing this she puts aside the self-imposed isolation of her deafness, and learns the value of her own identity.

results.title: The Staunch tin soldier
results.brief_description: A puppet film for children based on the fairy tale by Hans Christian Anderson. Tin soldiers are cast and appear among the other toys on the birthday table. At night the toys come to life and the staunch tin soldier who has only one leg, falls in love with the little dancer.

results.title: The Star child
results.creator_credit: Ted Berenson, Sal Campo, Tony Chaskelson and Billy Budd Films
results.brief_description: Two woodcutters, Gustave and Sven, witness a shooting star one cold evening and go searching for the gold they believe is at the end of it. Instead, the delivery is a little baby whom they take home, call Pero (love), and are convinced will grow up to be a great leader. On maturation he grows into a bully of a child who is unconvinced that the beggar woman who turns up in the village can be the mother of such a beautiful child as him. Thus begins a journey for the source of true beauty and a task that will test his level of compassion. Adapted from a short story by Oscar Wilde and animated by Lindsay Van Blerk, Min Che Lin, Brett Schuman and Ted Berenson. Voices: Keith Grenville, Joe Wishnia, Liz Williams, Linda Delport.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ted Berenson, Sal Campo, Tony Chaskelson and Billy Budd Films

results.title: The Stamp Collector
results.brief_description: This compilation program includes two films on stamps in the Australian and Pacific regions. “Pictures that Post” looks at the objects and artworks which have made their way onto our postage stamps. “A Fragile Piece of History” documents the final re-enactment of the tin can mail delivery in the Tongan islands.

results.title: The Stable door
results.creator_credit: Pat Jackson, Ronald H. Riley and Ronald H Riley and Associates
results.brief_description: While a gang plan to rob a warehouse, an insurance company tries to persuade the owners of the warehouse to improve their security arrangements. The result proves the value of precautions, which apply equally in the home, office or factory.

results.title: The Spruce bog: an essay in ecology
results.creator_credit: Dalton Muir, Guy Glover, J.V. Durden and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Describes the conditions under which a spruce bog is formed, with details of the plant types found at successive stages of development from open water to mature spruce forest. Time-lapse photography illustrates the growth and decay of vegetation preceding the appearance of sphagnum moss which chokes off water to make the floor of the forest. Discusses the commercial use of peat extracted from such bogs, and the value of black spruce to Canada’s pulp industry. Written by J.V. Durden. Photography by Dalton Muir. Editing by J.V. Durden. Music by Robert Fleming. Sound by George Croll. Voice and Narration by Geoffrey Hogwood. (Award: Salerno)

results.title: The Sport parade: sport spellbinders
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items featuring a variety of sports including: 1. The sport of fishing turned commercial - tuna fishing off the Galapagos Islands. 2. Action over the high hurdles, obstacle race, broad-jump, high jump, polevault (photography showing athletes in slow-motion). 3. Skiing on the sand, water skiing in Florida’s Biscayne Bay. 4. Sports in the Maine Woods - kayaks shoot the rapids of a roaring mountain stream, flat-bottome boats. 5. Outboard motor boats racing at high speeds. 6. The sport of kings - a steeplechase race. 7. Motorcycle race up a hill to the top. 8. Jalopy Derby free for all.

results.title: The Sport parade: ski revels
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine item about life on a ski field, from the snowplows that clear the roads to the field through to the actual skiing. Shows amateurs and professionals, old-fashioned horse drawn skiing, modern ski lifts, skiing with wings (ie for transport) and the practical uses of skiing.
